text: all flights in and out of Gatwick
Britain's second busiest airport have
been suspended after two drones were
seen flying near the runway 10,000
passengers have been affected with many
facing long delays flights have been
diverted as far away as Paris and
Amsterdam Gatwick has apologised for any
inconvenience but said safety was its
foremost priority Andy Moore reports
early this morning and Gatwick Airport
was full of hundreds of people trying to
rearrange flights or just find a bed for
the night the airport apologized to its
passengers but said their safety was its
foremost priority all flights into and
out of the airport had to be suspended
after there were multiple sightings of
two drones over the runway more than two
dozen inbound flights were diverted to
other UK airports but Gatwick many
passengers sat waiting in planes on the
runway before finally being offloaded
that's ridiculous how many millions
because the tens of thousands if not
hundreds of thousands of pounds in
delays absolutely ludicrous we were
traveling from Glasgow to Gatwick and
after being held on the plane for around
two hours we eventually go off and go
bus which took us here to
to get to the problem of drones near
airports is a worldwide concern in the
UK the authorities say the number of
near misses has trebled in the last two
years there were 92 incidents last year
alone Gatwick will be hoping to operate
as normal today but the Christmas travel
plans of thousands of people have been
severely disrupted Andy Moore BBC news
Gatwick Airport and let's go live to
Gatwick and speak to Andy now Andy as
you told us in that headline a moment
ago there is still a drone above the
airport this disruption started at 9:00
p.m. last night it's now 9:00 a.m. this
morning what's going on to try to end it
well certainly there's a major police
operation underway about 20 police units
are out and about around the airport
trying to find the drone or drones and
more importantly the operator of those
tiny little aircraft when I arrived here
last night the police helicopter was up
taking part in that operation we're told
by the police that they can't shoot down
the drones because that would be a
danger to safety let's just get this
update from the authorities here at the
airport on the latest situation so at
the moment we're still getting sightings
of the drone in and around the airfield
I've got over 20 units from Surrey and
Sussex and from the airport searching
for the drone operators to try and
locate him and we're exploring other
options at the moment to try and bring
this situation to a close it appears to
be a deliberate act absolutely you know
this has been going on for 10 hours now
each time we get we believe we get close
to the operator the dr√¥me disappears
when we look to reopen the airfield the
driver reappears so I'm absolutely
convinced it's a deliberate act to
disrupt Gatwick Airport do you know why
anybody would want to do that no not at
all and actually there's been no
intelligence you know that this is going
to happen this is just a random act
that's happened overnight
are you confident that you will locate
the operation of that drone I'm
convinced we will it's a painstaking

bigger the droning the further the reach

challenging thing to locate them but
I've got teams now and I've got

operate open as soon as possible the

at the earliest meanwhile it's is
causing travel chaos for tens of

hot in there very crowded we've had

so a terrible situation here at the
airport never a good time for a major
airport like this to be closed for it to
happen just before Christmas is the
worst possible time firstly I'd like to
apologize to all the passengers had been
disrupted by this irresponsible acts and
9 o'clock last night a drone was seen by
two different members of staff and since
then that drone has appeared and
reappeared all through the night we
reopened at 3 a.m. for 45 minutes but
then the drone reappeared again and so
the airport is closed now there is a

five years imprisonment is the

so as we heard there that police
